website_summaries.verdict: If your demands don't require a fixed f/2.8 zoom lens, the Canon EF 24-70mm f/4L IS USM will reward you with sharp images and a useful zoom range.

customer_reviews.title: Expansive but really, really great lens!
customer_reviews.text: Clearly one of the best lenses available out there, and I'm surely not going to be the one who gives a negative review to such a great piece of equipment. If this focal length is the right one for you, then look no further and don't be afraid of buying it because it never fails to impress. Well done, Canon!

customer_reviews.title: Lens was good but something went very wrong
customer_reviews.text: Lens was good and had no real issues getting to grips witb it but disaster struck! Had taken lens on holiday and as stated no issues but then worst nightmare happened when on a beach! The lens was fine and then just seemed to fall off from the main body...always check that its im secure and had been using it and even holding the lens part too. No idea what went wrong but have to assume design flaw with this particular lens as all years i have had other lens this has never happened so this is why a lower review. For the price these lens go for I could not believe this happened.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use with my EOS 600D Excellent quality. One thing to note - if you're used to using the 'standard' lens that came with the camera (EF-S 18-55 for instance), this is a lot heaver. However I think the images it can produce are well worth it.

customer_reviews.title: Great for working photographers
customer_reviews.text: What a great lens! I use this with my 5D Mark III and it is a fantastic all-rounder. It may be a little boring for hobbyists, but if you need a high quality, reliable lens then you really can't go wrong with this one.

customer_reviews.title: Canon EF 24-70mm f/4L
customer_reviews.text: An excellent Canon L series lens, bought to work alongside other Ls. The build quality is excellent and the image quality is excellent too. I haven't really pushed the capabilities of the new 4-stop IS, but it's good to know it's there if I need it. I haven't made much use of the macro mode, but preliminary experiments have been encouraging.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. J. Meade

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality from the Canon EF 24-70mm f/4
customer_reviews.text: I have been eager to purchase this lens for sometime, so as Canon had a cash back offer I took the opportunity. I have a Canon 7D and have been using an EF-S 15-85mm IS USM lens. It has been a good quality lens, but the new EF 24-70mm f/4L IS USM is just excellent. I haven't put it through its paces yet, but the images I have taken so far are so pin sharp. The addition of a macro option is so useful for me ,as I do a lot of insect photography. The "L" series lenses are worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bance

customer_reviews.title: Great but little used
customer_reviews.text: A really great lens but I hardly ever use it! Excellent optics and f 2.8 aperture, but for a full frame camera it lacks the very useful longer focal length of EF 24-105 which is the lens that is always with me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not at all disappointed in fact the lens has put a massive grin ...
customer_reviews.text: Spent a lot of time mulling over my second L series purchase after buying a 200mm prime earlier this year. Wanted a go anywhere (well most places) zoom. Read lots and was unsure what to choose on a cropped sensor (7D Mk ii), finally took the plunge on the 24-70mm f/4L. Not at all disappointed in fact the lens has put a massive grin on my face every time I use it. I love the results I am getting. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Image quality issues.
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: this is a review of the 24-70 f4. Amazon seem to have combined reviews from different lenses. I bought 2 of these lenses from amazon and returned both due to an issue with poor centering. Between 50-70mm, at long distances, one side of the frame is noticeably softer than the other. Both lenses had different manufacturing dates. I have since purchased the 24-70 f2.8 ii and have had no such problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Al

customer_reviews.title: What a terrible mistake. Lens has massive fault
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens 7 month ago. Never thought to check it. Thought made by CANON, no need for it.... What a terrible mistake. Lens has massive fault, it won't focus properly if set for more than 24mm !!! All images starting on 30mm ar massively blurred! ... No idea what to do apart leaving this review to warn everybody who may considering buying one. Have 24-105 mm lens and never had a problem... Now, after reading lots of review on a forums realised that this lens has fault. How come CANON can sell it at all !!!! Its not like some company in China-its Canon!.....
